parameters.description: For filtering: Name of the associated productSpecCharacteristic

parameters.name: prodSpecCharValueUse.valueType
parameters.description: For filtering: A kind of value that the characteristic can take on, such as numeric, text and so forth

parameters.name: prodSpecCharValueUse.minCardinality
parameters.description: For filtering: The minimum number of instances a CharacteristicValue can take on. For example, zero to five phone numbers in a group calling plan, where zero is the value for the minCardinality.

parameters.name: prodSpecCharValueUse.maxCardinality
parameters.description: For filtering: The maximum number of instances a CharacteristicValue can take on. For example, zero to five phone numbers in a group calling plan, where five is the value for the maxCardinality.

ProductOffering.description: Represents entities that are orderable from the provider of the catalog, this resource includes pricing information.

isBundle.description: isBundle determines whether a productOffering represents a simple product Offering (false), or a bundled product offering(true).If false, then a productSpecification will be returned, but the bundledProductOfferings will be absent or empty and vice-versa if isBundle is true.

lastUpdate.description: Date and time of the last update.

lifecycleStatus.description: Used to indicate the current product offering approval status (approved/check/unapproved).

validFor.description: The period for which the productOffering is valid (online date - offline date).

@type.description: Class type of the product offering

@baseType.description: Immediate base (class) type of the product offering

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing this product offering

isSellable.description: A flag indicating if this product offering can be sold as stand-alone or not. If this flag is false it indicates that the offer can only be sold within a bundled product offering.

attachment.description: Media items configured for a product offering (images, videos).

bundledProductOffering.description: List of children product offering reference (sent only for bundled product offerings).

parentBundleProductOffering.description: A list of BundledProductOffering representing all parents of the offering.

prodSpecCharValueUse.description: The list of Product Specification Characteristic Values defined for the ProductOffering.

classificationAttributeValueUse.description: The list of classification attributes defined for the ProductOffering.

offeringGroup.description: List of containing offering groups (sent only for BundleProductOfferings).

variantProductOffering.description: List of variants of the product offering.

variantOption.description: Variant options, in case of a variant product offering.

ProductOfferingPriceRef.description: ProductPriceOffering reference. An amount, usually of money, that is asked for or allowed when a ProductOffering is bought, rented, or leased.

@schemaLocation.description: Hyperlink reference to the schema describing this resource

ProductOfferingPrice.description: Is based on both the basic cost to develop and produce products and the enterprises policy on revenue targets. This price may be further revised through discounting (productOfferPriceAlteration). The price, applied for a productOffering may also be influenced by the productOfferingTerm, the customer selected, eg: a productOffering can be offered with multiple terms, like commitment periods for the contract. The price may be influenced by this productOfferingTerm. A productOffering may be cheaper with a 24 month commitment than with a 12 month commitment.

isBundle.description: A flag indicating if this ProductOfferingPrice is composite (bundle) or not

priceType.description: A category that describes the price, such as recurring, discount, allowance, penalty, and so forth.

bundledPop.description: Represents the contained prices (charges), for a composed price.

price.description: The amount of money that characterizes the price.

unitOfMeasure.description: A number and unit representing how many (for instance 1 dozen) of an ProductOffering is available at the offered price. Its meaning depends on the priceType. It could be a price, a rate, or a discount.

usageUnit.description: Usage unit applicable for the price.

cycle.description: Represents the start time, and end time of the recurring cycle (the first 3 months) . If empty, the cycle is the entire recurring period.

usageChargeType.description: The type of the usage charge

@schemaLocation.description: hyperlink reference to the schema describing this resource

@type.description: The class type of this Product offering price

PriceContext.description: Represents the context in which the product offering price is available to customer.

poRelationship.description: Represents the product offering affected, or required by the price. This field is used for bundle product offerings.

isPriceOverride.description: A flag indicating if the price is defined directly for a simple product offering, or for a product offering bought as part of a bundled product offering.

validFor.description: The period for which the productOfferingPrice is valid.

processType.description: Represents the purchasing flows for which the price is applicable.

place.description: Place references where the products are sold or delivered.

IndexedProductOffering.description: IndexedProductOffering subtype of the ProductOffering entity.

facetSearchOption.description: Represents the facet search value field name and value used for filtering.

isInStock.description: Flag to indicate if the product is in stock or not.

BundledProductOffering.description: A type of ProductOffering that belongs to a grouping of ProductOfferings made available to the market. It inherits of all attributes of ProductOffering.

lifecycleStatus.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status

bundledProductOfferingOption.description: A set of numbers that specifies the lower and upper limits for a ProductOffering that can be procured as part of the related BundledProductOffering. Values can range from 0 to unbounded.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

BundledProductOfferingOption.description: A set of numbers that specifies the lower and upper limits for a ProductOffering that can be procured as part of the related BundledProductOffering. Values can range from 0 to unbounded

numberRelOfferDefault.description: Default number of product offerings that should be procured as part of the related BundledProductOffering

numberRelOfferLowerLimit.description: Lower limit for a product offering that can be procured as part of the related BundledProductOffering

numberRelOfferUpperLimit.description: Upper limit for a product offering that can be procured as part of the related BundledProductOffering

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

AgreementItemRef.description: Agreement reference. An agreement represents a contract or arrangement, either written or verbal and sometimes enforceable by law, such as a service level agreement or a customer price agreement. An agreement involves a number of other business entities, such as products, services, and resources and/or their specifications.

id.description: Unique identifier of a related entity.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

@referredType.description: The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation.

RelatedProductOrderItem.description: RelatedProductOrderItem (ProductOrder item) .The product order item which triggered product creation/change/termination.

orderItemAction.description: Action of the order item for this product

orderItemId.description: Identifier of the order item where the product was managed

productOrderId.description: Unique identifier of a related entity.

role.description: role of the product order item for this product

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

@referredType.description: The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation.

id.description: Unique identifier of a related entity.

value.description: The resource value that can be used to identify a resource with a public key (e.g.: a tel nr, an msisdn)

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

@referredType.description: The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation.

ServiceRef.description: Service reference, for when Service is used by other entities

id.description: Unique identifier of a related entity.

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

Product.description:
A Product represents the subscription of a ProductOffering by a Party playing a PartyRole, such as a Customer.  For example, Jean has subscribed to company ABCs internet ProductOffering.
The association between ProductSpecification and Product allows ProductSpecification, to be instantiated as Product and related to customers or other involved parties.

description.description: The description of the product. It could be copied from the description of the Product Offering.

isBundle.description: If true, the product is a ProductBundle which is an instantiation of a BundledProductOffering. If false, the product is a ProductComponent which is an instantiation of a SimpleProductOffering

isCustomerVisible.description: If true, the product is visible by the customer

name.description: The name of the product. It could be the same as the name of the Product Offering

orderDate.description: The date from which the product starts

productSerialNumber.description: Serial number for the product. This is typically applicable to tangible products e.g. Broadband Router.

startDate.description: The date from which the product starts

terminationDate.description: The date when the product was terminated. Not applicable to active products

@baseType.description: Indicates the base type of the resource. Here can be 'Product'

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing this REST resource.
